member.name: T:CommunityToolkit.WinUI.Notifications.AdaptiveGroup
member.summary: Groups semantically identify that the content in the group must either be displayed as a whole, or not displayed if it cannot fit. Groups also allow creating multiple columns. Supported on Tiles since RTM. Supported on Toasts since Anniversary Update.

member.name: P:CommunityToolkit.WinUI.Notifications.AdaptiveGroup.Children
member.summary: Gets the only valid children of groups are . Each subgroup is displayed as a separate vertical column. Note that you must include at least one subgroup in your group, otherwise an will be thrown when you try to retrieve the XML for the notification.

member.name: P:CommunityToolkit.WinUI.Notifications.AdaptiveImage.HintRemoveMargin
member.summary: Gets or sets a value whether a margin is removed. images have an 8px margin around them. You can remove this margin by setting this property to true. Supported on Tiles since RTM. Supported on Toast since Anniversary Update.

member.name: P:CommunityToolkit.WinUI.Notifications.AdaptiveImage.HintAlign
member.summary: Gets or sets the horizontal alignment of the image. For Toast, this is only supported when inside an .

member.name: P:CommunityToolkit.WinUI.Notifications.AdaptiveImage.Source
member.summary: Gets or sets the URI of the image (Required). Can be from your application package, application data, or the internet. Internet images must be less than 200 KB in size.

member.name: P:CommunityToolkit.WinUI.Notifications.AdaptiveImage.AlternateText
member.summary: Gets or sets a description of the image, for users of assistive technologies.

member.name: P:CommunityToolkit.WinUI.Notifications.AdaptiveImage.AddImageQuery
member.summary: Gets or sets set to true to allow Windows to append a query string to the image URI supplied in the Tile notification. Use this attribute if your server hosts images and can handle query strings, either by retrieving an image variant based on the query strings or by ignoring the query string and returning the image as specified without the query string. This query string specifies scale, contrast setting, and language.

member.summary: Gets or sets the text to display. Data binding support added in Creators Update, only works for toast top-level text elements.

member.name: P:CommunityToolkit.WinUI.Notifications.AdaptiveText.Language
member.summary: Gets or sets the target locale of the XML payload, specified as a BCP-47 language tags such as "en-US" or "fr-FR". The locale specified here overrides any other specified locale, such as that in binding or visual. If this value is a literal string, this attribute defaults to the user's UI language. If this value is a string reference, this attribute defaults to the locale chosen by Windows Runtime in resolving the string.

member.name: P:CommunityToolkit.WinUI.Notifications.AdaptiveText.HintStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the style that controls the text's font size, weight, and opacity. Note that for Toast, the style will only take effect if the text is inside an .

member.name: P:CommunityToolkit.WinUI.Notifications.AdaptiveText.HintWrap
member.summary: Gets or sets a value whether text wrapping is enabled. For Tiles, this is false by default. For Toasts, this is true on top-level text elements, and false inside an . Note that for Toast, setting wrap will only take effect if the text is inside an (you can use HintMaxLines = 1 to prevent top-level text elements from wrapping).

member.name: P:CommunityToolkit.WinUI.Notifications.AdaptiveText.HintMaxLines
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of lines the text element is allowed to display. For Tiles, this is infinity by default. For Toasts, top-level text elements will have varying max line amounts (and in the Anniversary Update you can change the max lines). Text on a Toast inside an will behave identically to Tiles (default to infinity).

member.name: P:CommunityToolkit.WinUI.Notifications.AdaptiveText.HintMinLines
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum number of lines the text element must display. Note that for Toast, this property will only take effect if the text is inside an .

member.summary: Gets or sets the horizontal alignment of the text. Note that for Toast, this property will only take effect if the text is inside an .

member.name: P:CommunityToolkit.WinUI.Notifications.Element_TileBinding.AddImageQuery
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value whether Windows should append a query string to the image URI supplied in the Tile notification. Use this attribute if your server hosts images and can handle query strings, either by retrieving an image variant based on the query strings or by ignoring the query string and returning the image as specified without the query string. This query string specifies scale, contrast setting, and language; for instance, a value of
"www.website.com/images/hello.png"
included in the notification becomes
"www.website.com/images/hello.png?ms-scale=100&ms-contrast=standard&ms-lang=en-us"

member.summary:
Gets or sets a sender-defined string that uniquely identifies the content of the notification. This prevents duplicates in the situation where a large Tile template is displaying the last three wide Tile notifications.
Required: NO

member.summary: Gets or sets an optional string to override the Tile's display name while showing this notification.

member.name: P:CommunityToolkit.WinUI.Notifications.Element_TileBinding.Language
member.summary: Gets or sets the target locale of the XML payload, specified as a BCP-47 language tags such as "en-US" or "fr-FR". The locale specified here overrides that in visual, but can be overridden by that in text. If this value is a literal string, this attribute defaults to the user's UI language. If this value is a string reference, this attribute defaults to the locale chosen by Windows Runtime in resolving the string. See Remarks for when this value isn't specified.

member.name: M:CommunityToolkit.WinUI.Notifications.Win32AppInfo.GenerateGuid(System.String)
member.summary: From https://stackoverflow.com/a/41622689/1454643 Generates Guid based on String. Key assumption for this algorithm is that name is unique (across where it it's being used) and if name byte length is less than 16 - it will be fetched directly into guid, if over 16 bytes - then we compute sha-1 hash from string and then pass it to guid.
member.param: Unique name which is unique across where this guid will be used.

member.name: P:CommunityToolkit.WinUI.Notifications.Element_ToastBinding.AddImageQuery
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value whether Windows should append a query string to the image URI supplied in the Tile notification. Use this attribute if your server hosts images and can handle query strings, either by retrieving an image variant based on the query strings or by ignoring the query string and returning the image as specified without the query string. This query string specifies scale, contrast setting, and language; for instance, a value of
"www.website.com/images/hello.png"
included in the notification becomes
"www.website.com/images/hello.png?ms-scale=100&ms-contrast=standard&ms-lang=en-us"

member.name: P:CommunityToolkit.WinUI.Notifications.Element_ToastBinding.Language
member.summary: Gets or sets the target locale of the XML payload, specified as a BCP-47 language tags such as "en-US" or "fr-FR". The locale specified here overrides that in visual, but can be overridden by that in text. If this value is a literal string, this attribute defaults to the user's UI language. If this value is a string reference, this attribute defaults to the locale chosen by Windows Runtime in resolving the string. See Remarks for when this value isn't specified.

And finally, certain properties like HintStyle aren't supported on the root children text elements, and only work inside an . If you use on devices without the Anniversary Update, the group content will simply be dropped.

member.summary: Gets or sets the target locale of the XML payload, specified as BCP-47 language tags such as "en-US" or "fr-FR". This locale is overridden by any locale specified in binding or text. If this value is a string reference, this attribute defaults to the locale chosen by Windows Runtime in resolving the string.

member.name: P:CommunityToolkit.WinUI.Notifications.ToastBindingShoulderTap.Image
member.summary: Gets or sets the image to be displayed in the shoulder tap notification. Required.

member.name: P:CommunityToolkit.WinUI.Notifications.ToastBindingShoulderTap.Language
member.summary: Gets or sets the target locale of the XML payload, specified as BCP-47 language tags such as "en-US" or "fr-FR". This locale is overridden by any locale specified in binding or text. If this value is a literal string, this attribute defaults to the user's UI language. If this value is a string reference, this attribute defaults to the locale chosen by Windows Runtime in resolving the string.

member.name: P:CommunityToolkit.WinUI.Notifications.ToastBindingShoulderTap.BaseUri
member.summary: Gets or sets a default base URI that is combined with relative URIs in image source attributes.

member.name: P:CommunityToolkit.WinUI.Notifications.ToastBindingShoulderTap.AddImageQuery
member.summary: Gets or sets a value whether Windows is allowed to append a query string to the image URI supplied in the Toast notification. Use this attribute if your server hosts images and can handle query strings, either by retrieving an image variant based on the query strings or by ignoring the query string and returning the image as specified without the query string. This query string specifies scale, contrast setting, and language.

member.summary: Configures the button to use system snooze activation when the button is clicked, using the default system snooze time.

member.name: M:CommunityToolkit.WinUI.Notifications.ToastButton.SetSnoozeActivation(System.String)
member.summary: Configures the button to use system snooze activation when the button is clicked, with a snooze time defined by the specified selection box.
member.param: The ID of an existing which allows the user to pick a custom snooze time. The ID's of the s inside the selection box must represent the snooze interval in minutes. For example, if the user selects an item that has an ID of "120", then the notification will be snoozed for 2 hours. When the user clicks this button, if you specified a SelectionBoxId, the system will parse the ID of the selected item and snooze by that amount of minutes.

member.name: T:CommunityToolkit.WinUI.Notifications.ToastButtonSnooze
member.summary: A system-handled snooze button that automatically handles snoozing of a Toast notification.

member.name: P:CommunityToolkit.WinUI.Notifications.ToastButtonSnooze.CustomContent
member.summary: Gets custom text displayed on the button that overrides the default localized "Snooze" text.

member.summary: Gets or sets an optional image icon for the button to display.

member.name: P:CommunityToolkit.WinUI.Notifications.ToastButtonSnooze.SelectionBoxId
member.summary: Gets or sets the ID of an existing in order to allow the user to pick a custom snooze time. Optional. The ID's of the s inside the selection box must represent the snooze interval in minutes. For example, if the user selects an item that has an ID of "120", then the notification will be snoozed for 2 hours. When the user clicks this button, if you specified a SelectionBoxId, the system will parse the ID of the selected item and snooze by that amount of minutes. If you didn't specify a SelectionBoxId, the system will snooze by the default system snooze time.

member.name: P:CommunityToolkit.WinUI.Notifications.ToastButtonSnooze.HintActionId
member.summary: Gets or sets an identifier used in telemetry to identify your category of action. This should be something like "Delete", "Reply", or "Archive". In the upcoming toast telemetry dashboard in Dev Center, you will be able to view how frequently your actions are being clicked.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. Initializes a system-handled snooze button that displays your text on the button and automatically handles snoozing.
member.param: The text you want displayed on the button.

member.name: F:CommunityToolkit.WinUI.Notifications.ToastAfterActivationBehavior.PendingUpdate
member.summary: After the user clicks a button on your toast, the notification will remain present, in a "pending update" visual state. You should immediately update your toast from a background task so that the user does not see this "pending update" visual state for too long.

member.summary: Gets or sets a string that is passed to the application when it is activated by the Toast. The format and contents of this string are defined by the app for its own use. When the user taps or clicks the Toast to launch its associated app, the launch string provides the context to the app that allows it to show the user a view relevant to the Toast content, rather than launching in its default way.

member.summary: Gets or sets the frames per second at which to animate the sprite sheet. Required value that must be greater than 0 but no larger than 120.

member.name: P:CommunityToolkit.WinUI.Notifications.ToastSpriteSheet.StartingFrame
member.summary: Gets or sets the starting frame of the sprite sheet. If not specified, it will start at frame zero.

member.name: T:CommunityToolkit.WinUI.Notifications.ToastTextBox
member.summary: A text box control on the Toast that a user can type text into.

member.name: M:CommunityToolkit.WinUI.Notifications.ToastTextBox.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. A new Toast TextBox input control with the required elements.
member.param: Developer-provided ID that the developer uses later to retrieve input when the Toast is interacted with.

member.name: P:CommunityToolkit.WinUI.Notifications.ToastTextBox.Id
member.summary: Gets the required ID property so that developers can retrieve user input once the app is activated.

member.name: P:CommunityToolkit.WinUI.Notifications.ToastTextBox.Title
member.summary: Gets or sets title text to display above the text box.

member.name: P:CommunityToolkit.WinUI.Notifications.ToastTextBox.PlaceholderContent
member.summary: Gets or sets placeholder text to be displayed on the text box when the user hasn't typed any text yet.

member.name: P:CommunityToolkit.WinUI.Notifications.ToastTextBox.DefaultInput
member.summary: Gets or sets the initial text to place in the text box. Leave this null for a blank text box.

member.name: T:CommunityToolkit.WinUI.Notifications.ToastVisual
member.summary: Defines the visual aspects of a Toast notification.

member.name: P:CommunityToolkit.WinUI.Notifications.ToastVisual.Language
member.summary: Gets or sets the target locale of the XML payload, specified as BCP-47 language tags such as "en-US" or "fr-FR". This locale is overridden by any locale specified in binding or text. If this value is a literal string, this attribute defaults to the user's UI language. If this value is a string reference, this attribute defaults to the locale chosen by Windows Runtime in resolving the string.

member.name: P:CommunityToolkit.WinUI.Notifications.ToastVisual.BaseUri
member.summary: Gets or sets a default base URI that is combined with relative URIs in image source attributes.

member.name: P:CommunityToolkit.WinUI.Notifications.ToastVisual.AddImageQuery
member.summary: Gets or sets a value whether Windows is allowed to append a query string to the image URI supplied in the Toast notification. Use this attribute if your server hosts images and can handle query strings, either by retrieving an image variant based on the query strings or by ignoring the query string and returning the image as specified without the query string. This query string specifies scale, contrast setting, and language.

member.name: P:CommunityToolkit.WinUI.Notifications.ToastVisual.BindingGeneric
member.summary: Gets or sets the generic Toast binding, which can be rendered on all devices. This binding is required and cannot be null.

member.name: P:CommunityToolkit.WinUI.Notifications.ToastVisual.BindingShoulderTap
member.summary: Gets or sets a binding for shoulder tap notifications, which integrate with My People. See the My People documentation for more info. New in Fall Creators Update.
